title: Claude Code Instructions
text: NEVER use Urban Institute API, NCES CCD, federal data source — entire point packages provide STATE-LEVEL data directly state . Federal sources aggregate/transform data differently lose state-specific details. state DOE source broken, FIX find alternative STATE source — fall back federal data.

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: Commits allowed Claude Code attribution, Co-Authored-trailers, emojis Write normal commit messages human wrote

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: PRs merged CI passes. Run checks locally opening PR:

title: Claude Code Instructions
code: # R package check (required) devtools::check()  # Python tests (required) system("pip install -e ./pymdschooldata && pytest tests/test_pymdschooldata.py -v")  # pkgdown build (required) pkgdown::build_site()

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: opening PR, verify: - [ ] devtools::check() — 0 errors, 0 warnings - [ ] pytest tests/test_pymdschooldata.py — tests pass - [ ] pkgdown::build_site() — builds without errors - [ ] Vignettes render (eval=FALSE hacks)

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: package includes tests/testthat/test-pipeline-live.R LIVE network tests.

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: URL Availability - HTTP 200 checks File Download - Verify actual file (HTML error) File Parsing - readxl/readr succeeds Column Structure - Expected columns exist get_raw_enr() - Raw data function works Data Quality - Inf/NaN, non-negative counts Aggregation - State total > 0 Output Fidelity - tidy=TRUE matches raw

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: See state-schooldata/CLAUDE.md complete testing framework documentation.

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: NEVER push directly main. changes must go PRs auto-merge:
code: # 1. Create feature branch git checkout -b fix/description-of-change  # 2. Make changes, commit git add -A git commit -m "Fix: description of change"  # 3. Push and create PR with auto-merge git push -u origin fix/description-of-change gh pr create --title "Fix: description" --body "Description of changes" gh pr merge --auto --squash  # 4. Clean up stale branches after PR merges git checkout main && git pull && git fetch --prune origin

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: Clean stale branches every time touch package:
code: # Delete local branches merged to main git branch --merged main | grep -v main | xargs -r git branch -d  # Prune remote tracking branches git fetch --prune origin

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: PRs auto-merge CI checks pass: - R-CMD-check (0 errors, 0 warnings) - Python tests (py{st}schooldata exists) - pkgdown build (vignettes must render) CI fails, fix issue push - auto-merge triggers checks pass.

title: Maryland School Data Expansion Research
text: Last Updated: 2026-01-04 Theme Researched: Graduation Rates

what: Source 1: MSDE State Board Cohort Graduation Rate Reports (PRIMARY)
title: Maryland School Data Expansion Research
text: URL Pattern: https://marylandpublicschools.org/stateboard/Documents/{YYYY}/{MMDD}/...pdf HTTP Status: 200 (verified 2024, 2023, 2022, 2019) Format: PDF (presentations/reports State Board Education) Years: 2015-2024 (data embedded PDFs, released annually February/March) Access: Direct download, authentication required State aggregate LEA (24 Local School Systems) school-level data reports Race/Ethnicity: American Indian/Alaska Native, Asian, Black/African American, Hispanic, Native Hawaiian/Pacific Islander, White, Two Races Gender: Male, Female : Economically Disadvantaged, Students Disabilities (SWD), Multilingual Learners, FARMS (Free Reduced-Price Meals)

title: Maryland School Data Expansion Research
text: URL: https://reportcard.msde.maryland.gov/Graphs/ HTTP Status: 200 (requires JavaScript rendering) Format: Interactive dashboard, PDF downloads school report cards Years: 2017-present Access: JavaScript-rendered dashboard (direct API discovered) Geographic Levels: State, LEA, School Primary source school-level graduation data DataDownloads directory returns 403 direct access Individual school PDFs available : reportcard.msde.maryland.gov/DataDownloads/{year}/{year}/School_{schoolcode}_{year}_ENG.pdf State-level PDF: reportcard.msde.maryland.gov/DataDownloads/2023/2023/State_2023_ENG.pdf (verified 200)

title: Maryland School Data Expansion Research
text: URL: https://opendata.maryland.gov/Education/Maryland-State-Department--Education-Performance/qfc2-mfn8 HTTP Status: Authentication Required (403 API access) Format: Socrata API, CSV available authenticated Years: 2011-present (based description) Access: Requires login/authentication - suitable automated access Notes: Contains “Four-Year Cohort High School Graduation Rate” blocked programmatic access

what: Source 4: Maryland Longitudinal Data System Center
title: Maryland School Data Expansion Research
text: URL: https://mldscenter.maryland.gov/DataDownloads.html HTTP Status: 404 (page found 2026-01-04) Notes: Previously hosted graduation-related data; may restructured

title: Maryland School Data Expansion Research
text: State Board presentations contain tables following structure:

previous_headings: Schema Analysis > Data Structure from PDF Sources
title: Maryland School Data Expansion Research
text: Note: Values “>= 95.0” used suppression rates high (Garrett, Queen Anne’s, Talbot, Worcester 2024).

title: Maryland School Data Expansion Research
text: LEA Codes: Maryland uses 24 Local School Systems (23 counties + Baltimore City) Existing package: get_lss_codes() returns 2-digit codes (01-24) school IDs graduation PDFs - school-level data available via Report Card

title: Maryland School Data Expansion Research
text: Suppression: Rates >= 95% shown “>= 95.0” presentations PDF format: Data must extracted via text parsing (pdftools) Excel/CSV: structured data files found direct download School-level data: available via JavaScript-rendered Report Card individual school PDFs Year lag: 5-year graduation rate always prior cohort year

title: Maryland School Data Expansion Research
text: Graduation rates key educational metric Data publicly available (PDFs) Fills major gap package functionality

title: Maryland School Data Expansion Research
text: PDF parsing required (pdftools dependency already Suggests) Multiple data structures across presentation formats Schema varies slightly year structured data files available

title: Maryland School Data Expansion Research
text: R/get_raw_graduation.R (NEW) - Download parse PDF files R/process_graduation.R (NEW) - Process raw data standard schema R/tidy_graduation.R (NEW) - Convert long format R/fetch_graduation.R (NEW) - Main user-facing function R/utils.R - May need additional helper functions

title: Maryland School Data Expansion Research
text: Create download_msde_graduation_pdf(end_year) fetch correct PDF Create parse_graduation_pdf(pdf_path, end_year) extract tables Handle varying PDF layouts across years extract_state_graduation_data(pdf_text) - State-level trend data extract_lea_graduation_data(pdf_text) - LEA-level rates extract_subgroup_graduation_data(pdf_text) - Demographic breakdowns fetch_grad(end_year, tidy = TRUE, use_cache = TRUE) Support fetch_grad_multi(end_years) time series require browser automation PDF parsing individual school reports Consider Phase 2

title: Maryland School Data Expansion Research
text: Given : - Data changes annually (per year February) - Historical data static - PDF parsing fragile Consider maintaining versioned CSV within package historical data, updated annually. : - reliable PDF parsing - Allow easier testing - Work offline

title: Maryland School Data Expansion Research
code: test_that("2024 state graduation rate matches published value", {   skip_if_offline()   data <- fetch_grad(2024)   state_data <- data |> filter(type == "State", metric == "4_year_grad_rate")   expect_equal(state_data$value, 87.6, tolerance = 0.1) })  test_that("2024 Baltimore City rate matches published value", {   skip_if_offline()   data <- fetch_grad(2024)   bc <- data |> filter(lea_name == "Baltimore City", metric == "4_year_grad_rate")   expect_equal(bc$value, 71.0, tolerance = 0.1) })  test_that("2024 cohort size matches published value", {   skip_if_offline()   data <- fetch_grad(2024)   state <- data |> filter(type == "State", metric == "cohort_size")   expect_equal(state$value, 67349) })

title: Maryland School Data Expansion Research
code: test_that("graduation rates in valid range", {   data <- fetch_grad(2024, tidy = TRUE)   rates <- data |> filter(grepl("grad_rate", metric))   expect_true(all(rates$value >= 0 & rates$value <= 100, na.rm = TRUE)) })  test_that("all 24 LEAs present", {   data <- fetch_grad(2024, tidy = TRUE)   leas <- data |> filter(type == "District") |> distinct(lea_name)   expect_equal(nrow(leas), 24) })  test_that("year-over-year change reasonable", {   data_24 <- fetch_grad(2024) |> filter(type == "State", metric == "4_year_grad_rate")   data_23 <- fetch_grad(2023) |> filter(type == "State", metric == "4_year_grad_rate")   yoy_change <- abs(data_24$value - data_23$value)   expect_lt(yoy_change, 5)  # Less than 5 percentage points })

title: Maryland School Data Expansion Research
text: Maryland publish graduation rate data structured formats (Excel, CSV, API). primary data source PDF presentations State Board Education. presents challenges: Fragile parsing: PDF layouts change, requiring ongoing maintenance Text extraction quality: pdftools may perfectly extract tabular data Multiple PDF sources: Different URLs formats across years

title: Maryland School Data Expansion Research
text: Phase 1 (MVP): - Parse state-level LEA-level data State Board PDFs - Support years 2019-2024 (well-documented period) - Store parsed historical data package reliability Phase 2 (Enhancement): - Add school-level data via Report Card PDF parsing - Add subgroup-level data extraction - Expand historical coverage 2015+

title: Maryland School Data Expansion Research
code: # Already in Suggests: pdftools  # For PDF text extraction

title: Maryland School Data Expansion Research
text: Maryland Report Card: https://reportcard.msde.maryland.gov MSDE Graduation Rate News: https://news.maryland.gov/msde/state-graduation-rate/ State Board Documents: https://marylandpublicschools.org/stateboard/Pages/Meetings.aspx

what: 1. Montgomery County is bigger than most states
title: Maryland Enrollment Trends
text: 160,000 students, Montgomery County Public Schools largest district Maryland among top 20 nation.
code: top_districts <- enr_current %>%   filter(is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students)) %>%   head(5) %>%   mutate(district_label = reorder(district_name, n_students))  ggplot(top_districts, aes(x = district_label, y = n_students)) +   geom_col(fill = colors["total"]) +   coord_flip() +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +   labs(title = "Maryland's Largest School Systems",        subtitle = "Montgomery County leads with 160,000+ students",        x = "", y = "Students") +   theme_readme()

what: 2. Prince George’s and Montgomery: A tale of two counties
title: Maryland Enrollment Trends
text: Maryland’s two largest systems serve similar numbers different demographics.
code: pg_mont <- enr_current %>%   filter(is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL",          district_name %in% c("Montgomery", "Prince George's"),          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian")) %>%   mutate(pct = pct * 100)  ggplot(pg_mont, aes(x = subgroup, y = pct, fill = district_name)) +   geom_col(position = "dodge") +   scale_fill_manual(values = c("Montgomery" = "#3498DB", "Prince George's" = "#E74C3C")) +   labs(title = "Demographics: Montgomery vs Prince George's",        subtitle = "Two counties, very different student populations",        x = "", y = "Percent of Students", fill = "") +   theme_readme()

title: Maryland Enrollment Trends
text: Baltimore City lost 15,000 students past decade, decline nearly 20%.
code: baltimore <- enr %>%   filter(is_district, district_name == "Baltimore City",          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  ggplot(baltimore, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.5, color = colors["total"]) +   geom_point(size = 3, color = colors["total"]) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma, limits = c(0, NA)) +   labs(title = "Baltimore City Enrollment Decline",        subtitle = "Lost 15,000 students over the past decade",        x = "School Year", y = "Students") +   theme_readme()

title: Maryland Enrollment Trends
text: White students now 40% enrollment. Hispanic students fastest-growing group.
code: demo <- enr %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian"))  ggplot(demo, aes(x = end_year, y = pct * 100, color = subgroup)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(size = 2.5) +   scale_color_manual(values = colors,                      labels = c("Asian", "Black", "Hispanic", "White")) +   labs(title = "Maryland Demographics Shift",        subtitle = "White students now under 40% of enrollment",        x = "School Year", y = "Percent of Students", color = "") +   theme_readme()

what: 5. The Eastern Shore tells a different story
title: Maryland Enrollment Trends
text: Rural counties like Worcester, Somerset, Dorchester losing students faster state average.
code: eastern_shore <- c("Worcester", "Somerset", "Dorchester", "Wicomico", "Caroline")  eastern <- enr %>%   filter(is_district, district_name %in% eastern_shore,          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   group_by(end_year) %>%   summarize(n_students = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop")  ggplot(eastern, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.5, color = colors["total"]) +   geom_point(size = 3, color = colors["total"]) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +   labs(title = "Eastern Shore Combined Enrollment",        subtitle = "Rural counties losing students faster than state average",        x = "School Year", y = "Students") +   theme_readme()

title: Maryland Enrollment Trends
text: Maryland lost 8% kindergartners 2021 cohort remains smaller.
code: k_trend <- enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment",          grade_level %in% c("K", "01", "06", "12")) %>%   mutate(grade_label = case_when(     grade_level == "K" ~ "Kindergarten",     grade_level == "01" ~ "Grade 1",     grade_level == "06" ~ "Grade 6",     grade_level == "12" ~ "Grade 12"   ))  ggplot(k_trend, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students, color = grade_label)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(size = 2.5) +   geom_vline(xintercept = 2021, linetype = "dashed", color = "red", alpha = 0.5) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +   labs(title = "COVID Impact on Grade-Level Enrollment",        subtitle = "Maryland lost 8% of kindergartners in 2021",        x = "School Year", y = "Students", color = "") +   theme_readme()

title: Maryland Enrollment Trends
text: Howard County maintains high enrollment exceptional diversity - model suburban integration.
code: howard <- enr_current %>%   filter(is_district, district_name == "Howard",          grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian", "multiracial")) %>%   mutate(subgroup_label = reorder(subgroup, -pct))  ggplot(howard, aes(x = subgroup_label, y = pct * 100)) +   geom_col(fill = colors["total"]) +   labs(title = "Howard County Demographics",        subtitle = "A model of suburban diversity",        x = "", y = "Percent of Students") +   theme_readme()

what: 8. Allegany and Garrett: Western Maryland’s struggle
title: Maryland Enrollment Trends
text: westernmost counties lost 20% students since 2009, reflecting population decline.
code: western <- c("Allegany", "Garrett")  western_trend <- enr %>%   filter(is_district, district_name %in% western,          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  ggplot(western_trend, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students, color = district_name)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(size = 2.5) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +   labs(title = "Western Maryland Enrollment",        subtitle = "Allegany and Garrett counties losing over 20% of students",        x = "School Year", y = "Students", color = "") +   theme_readme()

title: Maryland Enrollment Trends
text: Maryland’s fifth-largest district maintained enrollment stability others fluctuate.
code: aa <- enr %>%   filter(is_district, district_name == "Anne Arundel",          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  ggplot(aa, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.5, color = colors["total"]) +   geom_point(size = 3, color = colors["total"]) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma, limits = c(0, NA)) +   labs(title = "Anne Arundel County Enrollment",        subtitle = "Maintaining stability while others fluctuate",        x = "School Year", y = "Students") +   theme_readme()

title: Maryland Enrollment Trends
text: Five counties along -95 (Baltimore, Montgomery, Prince George’s, Howard, Anne Arundel) enroll 70% Maryland students.
code: i95 <- c("Baltimore County", "Montgomery", "Prince George's", "Howard", "Anne Arundel")  corridor <- enr_current %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   mutate(corridor = ifelse(district_name %in% i95, "I-95 Corridor", "Rest of Maryland")) %>%   group_by(corridor) %>%   summarize(n_students = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop")  ggplot(corridor, aes(x = corridor, y = n_students, fill = corridor)) +   geom_col() +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +   scale_fill_manual(values = c("I-95 Corridor" = "#2C3E50", "Rest of Maryland" = "#95A5A6")) +   labs(title = "The I-95 Corridor Dominates Maryland",        subtitle = "Five counties along I-95 enroll over 70% of all students",        x = "", y = "Students") +   theme_readme() +   theme(legend.position = "none")

title: Maryland School Data
text: Documentation | Enrollment Trends Fetch analyze Maryland school enrollment data Maryland State Department Education (MSDE) R Python.

what: What can you find with mdschooldata?
title: Maryland School Data
text: 12 years enrollment data (2014-2025). 890,000 students. 24 local school systems. ten stories hiding numbers - see full analysis interactive visualizations Enrollment Trends vignette: Montgomery County bigger states - 160,000 students, Montgomery County Public Schools largest district Maryland Prince George’s Montgomery: tale two counties - Similar size, different demographics Baltimore City’s enrollment freefall - Lost 15,000 students decade Maryland majority-minority state - White students now 40% enrollment Eastern Shore tells different story - Rural counties losing students faster state average Kindergarten dipped COVID - Maryland lost 8% kindergartners 2021 Howard County: Suburban success story - model suburban diversity Western Maryland’s struggle - Allegany Garrett counties lost 20% students Anne Arundel holds steady - Maintaining stability others fluctuate -95 corridor dominates - Five counties enroll 70% students

title: Maryland School Data
Maryland School Data
code: library(mdschooldata) library(dplyr)  # Fetch one year enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Fetch multiple years enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2020:2024)  # State totals enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  # Compare largest districts enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students)) %>%   head(10)  # Demographics by county enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian")) %>%   select(district_name, subgroup, n_students, pct)

title: Maryland School Data
code: import pymdschooldata as md  # Fetch one year enr_2024 = md.fetch_enr(2024)  # Fetch multiple years enr_multi = md.fetch_enr_multi([2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024])  # State totals state_total = enr_2024[     (enr_2024['is_state'] == True) &     (enr_2024['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &     (enr_2024['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') ]  # Compare largest districts districts = enr_2024[     (enr_2024['is_district'] == True) &     (enr_2024['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &     (enr_2024['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') ].sort_values('n_students', ascending=False).head(10)  # Demographics by county demographics = enr_2024[     (enr_2024['is_district'] == True) &     (enr_2024['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') &     (enr_2024['subgroup'].isin(['white', 'black', 'hispanic', 'asian'])) ][['district_name', 'subgroup', 'n_students', 'pct']]

title: Maryland School Data
text: Data sourced Maryland State Department Education (MSDE): - Maryland Report Card: https://reportcard.msde.maryland.gov - MSDE Publications: https://marylandpublicschools.org//Pages/DCAA/SSP/

title: Maryland School Data
text: Levels: State, District (24 Local School Systems), School (~1,400) Demographics: White, Black, Hispanic, Asian, Native American, Pacific Islander, Multiracial Gender: Male, Female Grade levels: PK 12

title: Maryland School Data
text: Maryland exactly 24 Local School Systems (LSS) - one per county plus Baltimore City LSS Codes: 2-digit codes (01 = Allegany 24 = Worcester) Baltimore City (03) separate Baltimore County (04) Enrollment date: September 30 official counts

title: Fetch Maryland enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Downloads processes enrollment data Maryland State Department Education (MSDE). Data includes enrollment race/ethnicity gender state, district (Local School System), school levels.

title: Fetch Maryland enrollment data — fetch_enr
Fetch Maryland enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: end_year school year. Year end academic year - eg 2023-24 school year year '2024'. Valid values 2019-present (MSDE Report Card publications provide data 2019 onwards). tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format subgroup column. FALSE, returns wide format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available. Set FALSE force re-download.

title: Fetch Maryland enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Data frame enrollment data. Wide format includes columns district_id, campus_id, names, enrollment counts demographic/grade. Tidy format pivots counts subgroup grade_level columns.

title: Fetch Maryland enrollment data — fetch_enr
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 2024 enrollment data (2023-24 school year) enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Get wide format enr_wide <- fetch_enr(2024, tidy = FALSE)  # Force fresh download (ignore cache) enr_fresh <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = FALSE)  # Filter to specific district (Baltimore City) baltimore <- enr_2024 |>   dplyr::filter(district_id == "03") } # }

what: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Downloads combines enrollment data multiple school years.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: end_years Vector school year ends (e.g., c(2022, 2023, 2024)) tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Combined data frame enrollment data requested years

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 3 years of data enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2022:2024)  # Track enrollment trends enr_multi |>   dplyr::filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   dplyr::select(end_year, n_students) } # }

what: mdschooldata: Fetch and Process Maryland School Enrollment Data — mdschooldata-package
title: mdschooldata: Fetch and Process Maryland School Enrollment Data — mdschooldata-package
text: Downloads processes school enrollment data Maryland State Department Education (MSDE). Provides functions fetching enrollment data Maryland Report Card system transforming tidy format analysis.

title: mdschooldata: Fetch and Process Maryland School Enrollment Data — mdschooldata-package
text: fetch_enr Fetch enrollment data school year fetch_enr_multi Fetch enrollment data multiple years tidy_enr Transform wide data tidy (long) format id_enr_aggs Add aggregation level flags enr_grade_aggs Create grade-level aggregations get_available_years Get available year range

title: mdschooldata: Fetch and Process Maryland School Enrollment Data — mdschooldata-package
text: cache_status View cached data files clear_cache Remove cached data files

title: mdschooldata: Fetch and Process Maryland School Enrollment Data — mdschooldata-package
text: Maryland uses hierarchical system 24 Local School Systems (LSS): 23 counties plus Baltimore City LSS Numbers: 2-digit codes (01-24) School Numbers: 4-digit codes within LSS

title: mdschooldata: Fetch and Process Maryland School Enrollment Data — mdschooldata-package
text: Data sourced exclusively Maryland State Department Education (MSDE): Maryland Report Card: https://reportcard.msde.maryland.gov/ MSDE Staff Student Publications: https://marylandpublicschools.org//Pages/DCAA/SSP/ Note: package use federal data sources (NCES, Urban Institute, etc.). data comes directly Maryland state sources.

title: mdschooldata: Fetch and Process Maryland School Enrollment Data — mdschooldata-package
text: Maryland enrollment data MSDE sources: 2019-present: Data available via MSDE publications Report Card Data collected September 30 school year

title: mdschooldata: Fetch and Process Maryland School Enrollment Data — mdschooldata-package
text: Maintainer: Al Martin almartin@example.com
